records.name: Umayyad West (Iberian Peninsula, except the north)
Ayyūbids (Egypt, Syria, Diyār Bakr, W Jazīra, Yemen)
Almohads or al-Muwaḥiddūn (N Africa and Spain)
Mulūk al-Ṭawāʾif/Reyes de Taifas (Central and Southern Spain)
Zurayʿids or Banū ʾl-Karam (S Yemen: Aden)
Āl Saʿūd (Najd, Ḥijāz, modern Saudi Arabia)
Keita Kings (Mali, N Guinea, Gambia, Senegal)
Rulers of Kanem and Bornu (E-Central Sudan)
Fulānī Rulers in Hausaland, Sokoto (N Nigeria, Niger Valley)
Nabhānī Rulers of Pate (Island of Pate, modern Kenyan coastland)
Mazrūʿī Liwalis of Mombasa (Mobasa, Pemba Island)
Āl Bū Saʿīd (Zanzibar and E Africa coastland)
Persia & Central Asia I: Western Persia, Central Asia, Iraq, Syria
Musāfirids or Sallārids (Daylam: Ṭārum and Samīran; Azerbaijan; Arrān)
Būyids or Buwayhids (N, W, S Persia; Iraq)
Kākūyids or Kākawayhids (Jibāl and Kurdistan)
records.gregorian_display: ca. 1008-51; feudatories of Seljuqs until mid 6th/mid 12th c.

records.name: Dābūyid Ispahbadhs (Gīlān; Rūyān, Ṭabaristān coastlands: Sārī)
Begtiginids (NE Iraq, Kurdistan: Irbīl; N Syria: Ḥarrān)
Eldigüzids or Ildegizids (Azerbaijan, Arrān, N Jibāl)
Nizārī Ismāʿīlīs in Persia (Persian mountainous regions Alamūt)
Persia & Central Asia II: Eastern Persia, Central Asia, Iraq
Karts or Kurts (E Khurāsān, N Afghanistan)
Qara Qoyunlu (E Anatolia, Azerbaijan, Iraq, W Persia)
Aq Qoyunlu (Diyār Bakr, E Anatolia, Azerbaijan, W. Persia, Fars, Kirman)
Seljuqs of Rūm (W-Central Anatolia: Konya; most of Anatolia)
Ḥamīd Oghullarï and Tekke Oghullarï (W-Central Anatolia, SW coastland)
Jāndār Oghullarï or Isfandiyār Oghullarï (Black Sea coastland)
Tāj al-Dīn Oghullarï (Black Sea Coast hinterland: Canik/Jānīk)
Dulghadïr Oghullarï or Dhū ʾl-Qadrids (SE Anatolia)
Ottomans (NW Anatolia, Balkans, Arab lands from Iraq to Algeria and Eritrea)
Central Asia & Far East: Mongols and Successors in Mongolia, Central Asia, Eastern Europe
Mongols and later Yüan Dynasty of China (Mongolia, China)
Il Khānids (Persia, Iraq, E and Central Anatolia)
Khāns of the Golden Horde (W Siberia, Khwārazm, S Russia)
Khāns of Astrakhān (Lower Volga and adjacent steppelands)
Khāns of Qāsimov (Ryazan to SE of Moscow)
Central Asia & Afghanistan: After the Mongols
Shïbānids (or Shaybānids) or Abū ʾl-Khayrids (Transoxania, N Afghanistan)
Toqay Temürids or Jānids or Ashtarkhānids (Transoxania, N Afghanistan)
Sharqī Sultans of Jawnpur (E-Central, N India)
Sultans and Rulers of Mālwa (Central India)
Sultans of Maʿbar or Madura (S Deccan)
Nawwāb-Viziers and Kings of Qudh (Awadh) (N India)
Abdālī or Durrānī Rulers and Kings (Afghanistan)
Rulers of Malacca (SW Coast of Malay peninsula)
